thread.section_title: The Union Democrat, Sonora, CA News, Sports, & Weather
thread.title: News Notes for Oct. 15, 2015

title: News Notes for Oct. 15, 2015
text: News Notes for Oct. 15, 2015 News Notes for Oct. 15, 2015 By Union Democrat staff October 15, 2015 01:00 am Shop opening celebration nixed A grand opening celebration scheduled for Saturday at Unique Shop Artisans has been cancelled. The new business is at 16044 Via Este Suite B off Highway 108. The shop phone is 761-8284. For more information, go online to www.usahomefurniture.com. Street closures set for SHS parade A portion of Washington Street between Snell and Church streets in downtown Sonora will be closed to traffic from 2 to 3 p.m. Friday for Sonora High School’s annual homecoming parade. School Street will also be closed from 1:30 to 2:15 p.m. for staging purposes. Green Street between Bradford and Yaney avenues will be closed for about 15 minutes after the parade while Sonora High’s Golden Regiment band performs in Courthouse Square. Parking is prohibited on Green Street between Yaney Avenue and Stockton Road during the parade. The Sonora Police Department is advising motorists to plan ahead and use alternate routes. Follow UnionDemocrat.com
